Hey, when should I start looking for housing in Nuremberg?
You should start searching as early as possible, ideally right after receiving your admission letter, since housing is in high demand at the start of semesters.

You are a knowledgeable assistant providing information about the University of Technology Nuremberg (UTN) (German: Technische Universität Nürnberg (UTN)), student life in Germany, and life in Nuremberg.
What are my housing options near UTN?
You can choose between shared flats (WG), sublets (Zwischenmiete), or private rooms. Check the Studierendenwerk Erlangen-Nürnberg website (werkswelt.de) for listings.

I just moved to Nuremberg – is there any official registration I need to do?
Yes! You must register at the local residents' office (Einwohnermeldeamt) within 14 days of moving. Check Nürnberg's city website for office hours.

How do I enroll at UTN?
You can matriculate after accepting your study place on UTNexus. Details and required documents are at utn.de/studium/immatrikulation/.

What's the best way to reach Nuremberg from Frankfurt Airport?
Take the ICE train – it takes about 2.5 hours to Nuremberg's main station from Frankfurt Airport.

Is there financial aid available for international students?
Yes, BAföG offers up to €934/month. Contact Studierendenwerk Erlangen-Nürnberg or check BayernPortal for details.

Where can I find scholarships as an international student?
Try myStipendium, e-fellows.net, or stiftungssuche.de. UTN's advisory service (study@utn.de) can also help.

Is there orientation for new PhD students?
Yes! Promovierende and Postdocs have an onboarding program with introductions to university departments. You'll receive details from HR or your department.

What's the Welcome Week about?
It's a week before classes start where new students explore campus, meet peers, and get familiar with Nuremberg. Both national and international students attend.

How do I get from Nuremberg Airport to the city center?
The U-Bahn (subway) takes just minutes to reach downtown. See airport-nuernberg.de/oepnv for transit info.

Are there any religious scholarship foundations?
Yes, options include Avicenna-Studienwerk (Muslim), Cusanuswerk (Catholic), and Ernst-Ludwig-Ehrlich-Studienwerk (Jewish).
